greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(n) = A048673(A048673(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(n) = (1/2) * (1 + A003961((1/2) * (1+A003961(n)))). [Where A003961(n) shifts the prime factorization of n one step left.]
mathematica: b[p_?PrimeQ] := b[p] = Prime[PrimePi[p] + 1]; b[1] = 1; b[n_] := b[n] = Times @@ (b[First[#]]^Last[#]&) /@ FactorInteger[n];
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 22 2014
